objects.name: Question1
objects.string:
What is the largest planet in the 
solar system?

objects.name: Question2
objects.string:
What object in the solar system 
sustains life on Earth?

objects.name: Question3
objects.string: Name the Moons of moons of Mars?

objects.name: Question4
objects.string:
What is the centre of the 
Milky Way?

objects.name: Question5
objects.string:
What spiral galaxy is the closest 
to the Milky Way?

objects.name: Question6
objects.string: What planet is named after a female?

objects.name: Question7
objects.string: What is the 7th planet from the Sun?

objects.name: Question8
objects.string:
What is the name of the group 
of celestial bodies that are between 
Jupiter and Mars?

objects.name: Question9
objects.string: What planet is Enceladus a moon of?

objects.name: Question10
objects.string: What planet is Titan a moon of?

objects.name: Question11
objects.string:
A solar eclipse is caused when 
sunlight  from the Sun is blocked 
by the _____.

objects.name: Question12
objects.string:
How long does Earth takes to 
orbit the sun once?

objects.name: Question13
objects.string:
The Earth is the _____ planet 
from the Sun.

objects.name: Question14
objects.string:
A ______ is a celestial body that
travels around the Sun.

objects.name: Question15
objects.string:
What is a rocky body regarded 
as a very small planet?

objects.name: Question16
objects.string:
An object that reaches and collides 
with the surface of the Earth.

objects.name: Question17
objects.string:
A small piece of matter that travels 
through space.

objects.name: Question18
objects.string:
System of 1 star, 8 planets and 
other spatial bodies.

objects.name: Question19
objects.string:
What is a force which acts over a 
distance between objects?

objects.name: Question20
objects.string:
The shape of the orbit that a planet 
takes as it orbits the Sun.

objects.name: Question21
objects.string:
What is the hottest planet in the 
solar system?

objects.name: Question22
objects.string:
What is the biggest planet in the 
solar system?

objects.name: Question23
objects.string:
The Earth is ____ kilometres away 
from the Sun.

objects.name: Question24
objects.string:
Astronomical object consisting of 
a luminous spheroid of plasma held
together by its own gravity.

objects.name: Question25
objects.string:
An ice giant planet and known as 
sideways planet because it rotates 
on its side.

objects.name: Question26
objects.string:
What is the largest asteroids name 
and what  has been detected on this 
asteroid that is significant?

objects.name: Question27
objects.string: What does Phobos and Deimos mean?

objects.name: Question28
objects.string:
What radiation is emitted from a 
Black Hole?

objects.name: Question29
objects.string:
What type of nuclear reaction is 
happening in the Sun?

objects.name: Question30
objects.string:
Path that an object in space takes as 
it travels around another object.

objects.name: FinishLineText
objects.string:
Well done!
Press any key to continue...

events.name: At the beginning of the scene

events.comment: Creation timing of Fuel and Asteroid
If player dies or runs out of fuel
When score reaches 8000. The player moves into the next planet
Update entry text object to display what the user types in

Validate the answer of the user.
if answer is correct, keep going.
if answer is wrong, goes back to main menu.
Set user input to lowercase to remove case sensitivity
No question repeats, all questions must be answered before repeat. (working on it)

objects.name: FinishLineText
objects.string:
Well done!
Press any key to continue...

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Allow an object to move smoothly on the X and/or Y axis following a sine wave, or an ellipsis.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SineMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Allow an object to move smoothly on the X and/or Y axis following a sine wave, or an ellipsis.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Allow an object to move smoothly on the X and/or Y axis following a sine wave.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: SineMovement

propertyDescriptors.label: Amplitude of the movement on X axis (0 to deactivate)
propertyDescriptors.name: AmplitudeX

propertyDescriptors.label: Amplitude of the movement on Y axis (0 to deactivate)
propertyDescriptors.name: AmplitudeY
